intro: Onosma exserta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are usually arranged oppositely along the stem. Onosma exserta is often found in open habitats such as dunes, scrublands, and coastal cliffs.
